alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cherokee; Cleburne; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 10 at 1:16AM CST until December 10 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Calhoun County in east central Alabama... Southeastern Etowah County in northeastern Alabama... East central St. Clair County in central Alabama... North central Cleburne County in east central Alabama... Southwestern Cherokee County in northeastern Alabama... * Until 200 AM CST. * At 116 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Neely Henry Lake to near Talladega Municipal Airport, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Anniston, Jacksonville, Rainbow City, Piedmont, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks, Glencoe, Weaver, Ragland, Ohatchee, Tennala, Blue Mountain, Alexandria, Jacksonville State University, and Ballplay. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Cherokee; Cleburne; Etowah; St. Clair
